intro: Erodium cicutarium var. lebelii, commonly known as the Lebel's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in the spring and summer, and its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three leaflets. It is an annual or biennial herb that spreads through seeds dispersed by wind and animals.
